snippet: The annual Orange Order parades, viewed by many Catholics as provocative and often set off sectarian violence, resulted in at least 20 police officers being injured during riots.
abstract: Annual Orange Order parades in Belfast, Northern Ireland, which are viewed by many Catholics as provocative and often set off sectarian violence, result in at least 20 police officers being injured during riots.
lead_paragraph: The annual Orange Order parades, viewed by many Catholics as provocative and often set off sectarian violence, resulted in at least 20 police officers being injured during riots.

headline.main: Northern Ireland: Officers Hurt in Riots
headline.print_headline: Northern Ireland: Officers Hurt in Riots
